1.content:
Tired beyond belief, Isaac (Our 18 year old protagonist) swung his dorm room door open and flipped the light switch. His room, while perhaps a bit untidy, was a comforting sight. After having sat through a rather difficult test, he was glad to be back in his dorm for a well deserved rest. Everything seemed just about right- his pants were on the floor where he left them (He really had to do a better job of cleaning his room) and his computer was still switched on, although it was now idle. Sighing, he shut the door behind him and picked his pants up off the floor, then lazily lobbed them into his collapsible hamper.

Turning to his bed (Which was of course, not made) he saw a sheet of paper he didn't recall leaving there. Unassuming as it was, he couldn't help but feel intrigued by this lone page, and so he picked it up, noticing almost immediately that this wasn't his paper.

The handwriting wasn't his, much nicer and more fluid, undoubtedly that of a female. On this paper was a short message, and oddly enough it was addressed to him.

"Dear Isaac, I don't have the time to explain what will happen next, though I'm sure you'll find a way to make use of the inheritance I've left you."

Inheritance?

The paper wasn't even signed, and the message was of the vaguest variety. A bit puzzled but still tired from his test, Isaac crumbled the paper and tossed it into the garbage bin next to his desk. It was nearly overflowing with other crumbled papers, and nearly tumbled off the pile and onto the floor.

Pushing the strange message to the back of his mind, Isaac changed into his sleepwear and brushed his teeth hastily, craving the sweet comfort of his mattress. Not even bothering to switch off the computer that still hummed silently, Isaac slipped into bed and was asleep within minutes, unaware of the changes to come.

11.content:
Isaac found himself in a quaint coffee shop, the kind that serve as an excellent backdrop for conversation. Sipping some hot chocolate, he looked around. It was raining outside, or at least he felt it must have been- something told him it was. The coffee shop was empty, except for a bear that was seated at a table near the door. As menacing as bears were, this one seemed completely absorbed in his work, namely the operation of an abacus and the recording of some data in his notebook. The bear spoke Russian to himself, but managed his order in nearly perfect English when the waitress asked him what he wanted.

It took Isaac a few seconds to realize how ridiculous this all was. Of course, he was dreaming.

"Rather uneventful," Isaac mused quietly as he looked about, "Not much of a dream here."

Turning back to his hot chocolate, Isaac was pleasantly surprised to see that there was now someone sitting across from him at his table. A mysterious character by all accounts, the figure was cloaked and had made no noise.

"And who might you be?" asked Isaac, studying the character.

"That doesn't matter," responded the cloaked person, "What matters is that you take the inheritance."

"Inheritance?"

Isaac struggled to recall the message left on his bed.

"That was you?"

The figure nodded and stretched out a feminine hand.

"Take it," it said simply.

"Take what?" Isaac asked, hoping he would awaken soon.

Refusing to respond, the character gripped Isaac's hand. His body was overrun with a chilling sensation, and he was frozen in place.

"It is done," said the character, though Isaac was still inanimate, "I've given you-"

"Take it," it said simply.

"Take what?" Isaac asked, hoping he'd awaken soon.

The character did not respond, but instead lunged over the table and at his neck, sinking his teeth into his skin.

Isaac shouted, feeling pain he had never before experienced in a dream- it was all too real for him.

(Unless you consider over-eating a power) However, it was more of a sliding scale of change rather than the black and white of the Hulk. The truth of his condition completely unknown to him, Isaac backed out of his driveway and started his day.

122.title: A Slow Possession

1222.content:
“Let’s work from the bottom up,” chuckled the ghost as she focused what little magic she had on the very bottom of Isaac’s body. “Hope you don’t mind size 5 in women’s feet!”

While the spirit worked her magic on Isaac, her host was still trying to remember how to be a human being. He was getting ready for his work study, which involved serving coffee to other tired students at the small shop on campus. It was a short job of 3 hours, but it gave Isaac a little extra money around campus. He had put on some half-decent clothes and was about to slip into his shoes when the transformation began.

Isaac felt an odd tingle in his toes as he tied his shoes up tight. He ignored it, completely unaware that the ghost was slowly starting to compress his feet to be more dainty and match her own when she was among the living. He didn’t even notice the fact that his shoes, a size 12 in mens, were considerably looser than usual.

“Must be time for new shoes,” he muttered as he stepped out into the bright morning light.

“Boy, this kid is thick,” the ghost thought to herself. “Here I was worried I might have to devote some of my magic to mental manipulation.”

But the ghost didn’t want to risk tempting her luck with how smooth the transformation was going. If Isaac became aware of what she was doing to him, he could fight back and even take control. She was the invader and it was Isaac’s body. But the more of the ghost rubbed off on her host, the less he could fight back. That was why she planned to take it as slow as possible.

Even shrinking his foot was done in waves. The phantom did a little as Isaac walked to work, just so that his shoes were slipping but not enough so that they would fall off completely. He grumbled as he walked about how worn out his footwear was, completely ignorant to the fact that it was his own feet that were a good few inches shorter than they were at the start of the day.

By the time Isaac got to work, the ghost had worn herself out.

“Damn,” she said as her magic fizzled. “Am I that weak? This is going to take longer than I thought…”

While the ghost mulled over her predicament, Isaac laced up his shoes tighter and stopped into his job.

The small coffee shop was situated in the building of one of Isaac’s campus halls, where there was a lot of through traffic for students seeking relief from exams. At the moment, there was only one person on hand working the counter.

“About time!” said the barista. “I figured you had slept in or something.”

The girl was Isaac’s co-worker, a short and stocky lass by the name of Emily. While she couldn’t quite compare to the girth of the ghost inhabiting Isaac’s body, she was definitely on the larger side. Her apron tightly clung around her bloated breasts and hips, which had expanded over the of working at a coffee store. The free donuts on hand for their service did not help her weight problem, but she was still a nice and intelligent girl two years to Isaac’s senior. She had medium brown hair and glasses. She did not looked impressed to see Isaac.

“Sorry, Em…”

“Save your apologies for later. Right now, I need your help to get some cappuccinos brewing. Go in the back and get your apron on.”

Isaac mumbled his reply under his breath, though the ghost was interested in this new person, Emily.

“Hmm...She could be of some use to me. A little on the tall side, but some of her clothes could work…”

While the ghost plotted her next move, Isaac was adjusting to his new shoe sizes, almost forgetting his ill-fitting footwear as he worked.

It wasn’t until around noon when the ghost could feel some of her power returning, though not nearly enough to allow her to continue the possession. Thankfully, Isaac’s growling stomach provided an alternative.

“Hey Em, want to get some lunch now that our shifts are over?”

“Only if you’re treating.”

The phantom’s metaphorical mouth watered. She hadn’t tasted food in years and she could only imagine sinking her teeth into a juicy burger with fries.

“Maybe the food would give me an energy boost and we can move this along.”

As the two co-workers headed off to lunch, the ghost gathered up as much energy as she could and focused on something a little bigger.

As Isaac sat in front of Emily chowing down on a cafeteria burger, the ghost got to work molded his bulky man hands into a more delicate form. His fingers dwindled in size both in length and thickness. The skin from his fingertips to his wrist lost all its roughness and traded it for a very soft, very sensitive. Even his nails, ragged from years of nail biting, became polished and trim. When all was said and done, Isaac’s hands were significantly smaller and more girlish.

“Huh,” he said looking down at his food. “This burger look bigger to you than usual, Em?”

“No, they’re the same size as always. Same greasy ball of grilled meat.”

“That’s odd,” Isaac said as he compared the food to his palm, which could barely hold the piece of meat in one hand.

“You could use the extra meat anyway. Barely a freshman and you look like you haven’t gained a pound.”

The small talk distracted Isaac from his shrunken hands. “What can I say? I guess I’m immune to the freshman fifteen.”

“We’ll have to fix that,” muttered Emily.

“Oh,” the ghost said to herself. “I think I like this girl.”

The one o’clock bell on the college’s clock tower rang out, signalling the time for the next class. Isaac cleaned up his plate, which was more challenging than usual with smaller hands, and stood up to begin his first lesson of the day.

“You doing anything tonight, Isaac?”

“Just the usual. Study and games. Why?”

“It’s usually movie night for me and Sarah, but she had to cancel because of exams. Want to join me instead?”

“I think our girl likes Isaac,” the ghost chuckled to herself. “I’m liking her more and more. I wonder if she would mind me instead?”

“Sure,” said Isaac, not picking up on the subtle hints of a woman. “I got nothing going on.”

“Well, this might be fun…” the ghost rubbed her hands together.

Isaac was a tall lanky boy, standing at around 6’3. In comparison to the spirit, he was a giant. She only got up to around 4’9 when she was among the living, almost child-like when next to Isaac. But she was about to fix that.

His pants felt the slightest bit looser, but didn’t fall off because of the belt he wore. “There,” she whispered. “I could do more, but anything bigger and he might notice.”

“What is up with me today?” he asked, holding up his pants. “All my clothes suddenly feel bigger. Do I need to go shopping for some new ones?”

“God, he’s really thick.”

Four inches made a huge difference in Isaac’s appearance, as he went from fairly tall to average in a blink of an eye. His clothes all looked too big on him now, with his jeans close to falling off and his T-Shirt looking more like something oversized for bed.

Thankfully, no one noticed until he got to Emily’s apartment.

His co-worker lived in the same door as him, only on a different floor. They shared a rather large building which housed a fair portion of the students who went to their small university. Being older, Emily got to live closer to the top which provided a better view of the city and a fun elevator ride.

Emily was wearing some comfortable looking pyjamas when Isaac knocked at her door. Isaac was taken by surprise at how large the girl suddenly looked, when she was normally much shorter than him. In fact everything about the dorm building looked bigger to him. Emily was 5’3 and normally was under his chin in height. Now, she was touching his nose.

The ghost wasn’t sure if she noticed the difference or not.

122211.title: Slightly Down to Size

1222112.content:
The ghost wasn’t quite sure if Emily had detected anything different about Isaac. She had just seen her co-worker a few hours ago, so out of anyone she should be able to compare that something wasn’t quite right. While there was surprise in her blue eyes, she wore a pleasant smile and suggested nothing was wrong.

“Come on in, make yourself comfortable.”

Isaac kicked off his shoes, which flew off easier than he would have expected, and entered Emily’s abode. Like all the student dorms in the building, she lived in a single apartment which came with two rooms and a bathroom. The smaller room was the bedroom, which reeked of perfume and incense. The larger room provided space for the living quarters, which included a TV and couch, and the tiny kitchen off to the side. Despite being a larger woman, Emily made the 800 square feet feel roomy and cozy.

“So, what’s on the showing tonight?”

“Stranger Things.”

“Sounds good to me.”

The two sat on the couch together and proceeded with the ritual of a college movie night, or Netflix show as was the case. Isaac handled most of the banter, not noticing that Emily was spending her time staring at him. At first, the ghost assumed it had to do with her suspicions of the girl’s crush on her host. But then she caught Emily glancing to Isaac’s feet, with loose fitting socks, and daintier hands. She also kept moving closer, like she was trying to compare heights with him.

“Has she caught on already?” the ghost pondered. “I suppose there’s one way to find out.”

The spirit focused her magic again on Isaac’s height, using the rest of her energy she had gathered from the time spent recharging in class. She envisioned he was like clay she could push down on and squashed him with all her might. Slowly, his body eased downwards as he sunk further into the couch. Isaac shifted uncomfortably, pulling at the collar of his shirt which was starting to slip off his shoulder. Finally, the ghost could not push anymore and settled on Isaac losing another 6 inches in height, bringing him down to a short height for a guy of 5’3. His head now perfectly aligned with Emily’s.

Emily picked up on Isaac’s shrinking, by the way her eyes seem to gleam under her glasses. The ghost recognized a hunger in the way Emily smiled as she stared at Isaac.

“I’m getting kind of hungry. Want to order a pizza?”

Isaac stomach growled. All that magic needed fuel and there was one surefire way the ghost inhabiting him could guarantee it. “Sure, but can we make it two?”

Emily was only too happy to consent. The ghost could not tell exactly what the girl was thinking, only that she absolutely notices the changes going on with Isaac. By her demeanor, she seems to approve them. But how could she know exactly what was going on? So long as she didn’t spill the beans, the ghost didn’t care.

When the pizza came, Emily answered the door and paid while Isaac paused the episode. As she set down the pies in the kitchen and Isaac rose from the couch, his jeans slipped clean off his waist, belt and all.

Emily chuckled heartily as Isaac scrambled to cover himself up. “You alright there, Isaac?”

“Y-Yeah, sorry about that. I have no idea what’s going on with my clothes today. It feels like everything just stretched out.”

“Sounds like you need some new clothes.”

“There’s no way. I just bought these like a month ago before school started.”

“Why don’t you borrow something of mine from my bedroom?” she asked. “It’s better than walking around like you’re a kid wearing your parents clothing.”

“Don’t be ridiculous, Em. There’s no way I could fit into something of yours.”

Isaac spoke without knowing that if he were to stand next to Emily, he would see that they were equal in height. Inside his head, the ghost was practically screaming to do it.

“Yes! Make him do it!”

“I don’t know, Isaac. I think I have something in there that might fit you better. Just give it a try, okay? I’ll prep the plates and drinks while you change.”

Between Emily and the ghost’s encouragements, Isaac reluctantly obeyed and slumped over to his host’s bedroom. Everything around him looked a whole foot bigger than it normally did and he had to reach up more to open the knob.

The inside of Emily’s room was much like the ghost expected. Emily was a bit of a bookworm, with a full shelf of various romance and fantasy novels. There was a table for her pink laptop and a bed, perfectly folded and tidy. It was the amount of clothes in the room that really highlighted the girl’s personality. She had a dresser and closet, within each was a literal mountain of clothes her size.

Being a big girl herself, the ghost could appreciate just how hard it was to come across outfits that fit perfectly. Emily must have collected these over the months when her weight settled down in college, as well as outfits from before she had gotten to the size she was. Her older clothes, while still meant for someone overweight, were stuffed away in the furthest reaches of the closet. It was there Isaac searched, hoping to find something that would suit him. The ghost subtly guided him in terms of fashion.

Together, they stumbled across two things Isaac could agree to wear. One was some grey sweatpants with an old pink v-neck T-shirt, which was the most neutral of the selections. The other was a large green robe, which could be found on the side of Emily’s bedroom door.

“Oh, so, many good decisions,” said the ghost. “Maybe I should keep him around this size and share in Emily’s extensive wardrobe. What are you going to pick then, boy?”

“I don’t know how this is supposed to fit me,” Isaac said to himself as he held up the big grey sweatpants. “I’m nowhere near as short as Emily.”

But, naturally, he was proven completely wrong as he removed his oversized jeans and slipped on the comfy pants. He tied the string tightly around his waist to keep them at his waist, but it was a much better fit than trying to wear his jeans.

“...Are these bigger than they look?”

Isaac threw the pink shirt over his head. Again, like the pants, they were a perfect fit save for the width. He played with the hewn, expecting it to ride up his stomach, but it rested nicely at his waist like a fitting shirt did.

“We’ll have to fill these up soon,” said the ghost. “I can hardly wait to start giving you curves.”

“Isaac?” Emily called out from the kitchen. “Pizza’s getting cold.”

The promise of food was enough to distract Isaac from the fact that Emily’s clothes had no business being the right size for him. He beelined right for the open pie of barbecue chicken pizza, not seeing that Emily had on a satisfied smirk as he passed by her.

“See? I told you I had something that would work for you.”

Isaac mumbled something between his bites of food. He was famished for some reason. That had to do with the ghost in his head, who was running on empty after managing to shrink him a foot in height to Emily’s size.

“We need food,” demanded the spirit. “We need fuel for the magic.”

Isaac was eating faster than Emily. Within five minutes, he was on his last slice and greedily looking at the remaining half pie that Emily had of her pizza.

“You know, Isaac,” said Emily. “You could spend the night if you wanted to. The couch is a pull out bed and is pretty comfortable.”

“That could work, I guess. We both have our shift tomorrow, right? You don’t mind me staying?”

“No, not at all! I could use the company tonight.”

Isaac finished off his pizza, but the ghost was still not satisfied. She was regaining her strength but it was still not enough to coax another full change. With how loose the sweatpants were on Isaac, she already had an idea of where she wanted to start next. Thankfully, it was like Emily had vision into Isaac’s mind.

“How about dessert?” asked the hostess. “I made some cookies yesterday.”

“Sure.”

Emily had come prepared to sate the appetite of the ghost as she produced a mountain of chocolate chip cookies from the kitchen counter. Without even waiting for her to put the plate down, Isaac got to work chowing down on the fist-sized sweets. Each cookie was like a power pellet in Pacman, combining with the pizza to give the spirit a charge of energy. By the time Isaac had his tenth, she was ready to try and work her magic again.

“Let’s add some junk in that skinny ass trunk!”

As Isaac chowed down on his cookies, the ghost reached down and fondled his backside in manner that she could be almost considered a physical being. Where she groped, his flesh expanded like a balloon being filled with air. Only it was not air, but heavy thick fat which plumpened everywhere from his rump to his thighs. With every bite he took, the ghost could make him grow more. The flat, dead folds of the sweatpants suddenly came with a wondrous bounty. When the last cookie was eaten, the spirit drained herself of all her energy. Like a candle, all her life gave out in an instant and Isaac’s butt wobbled into its new shape.

His waist had grow several inches, enough so that the string was beginning to cut into his side. His thighs, once so thin that he could fit both hands around them, were now thick and meaty like plump cooked sausages. But more impressive of all was his butt, which had grown tenfold.
